title: I'm A Celeb's Harry Redknapp fears fiery Ian Wright will suffer jungle meltdown
text:

I'm A Celeb champion Harry Redknapp fears his old pal Ian Wright will lose his cool and suffer a meltdown in the jungle this year.

Former footballer Ian is rumoured to be joining the 2019 cast, and Harry has now explained how he thinks Ian might get on.

Harry, 72, says the Arsenal legend might cause some drama in the jungle camp, but viewers are sure to love him.

He told Mirror Online exclusively: "He's crazy. Whether he can keep his cool for three weeks, that's the question."

Harry added: "He'd be great fun. He's a great lad, Wright - I love him."

The King of the Jungle took his throne last year after he won over the public with his down-to-earth attitude, hilarious observations and dedication to loving wife, Sandra.

(Image: David Cannon/Getty Images)

(Image: Getty Images)

He became close friends with actress Emily Atack, who was the runner-up.

Ian Wright recently spoke to The Mirror about his childhood, and how his career in football came after he found solace from his home life in the sport.

Since then, he's carved out a epic career as a footballer and now a pundit, and has become a favourite with fans.

Now, those same fans hope to see him in a setting a fry cry from a football stadium - the Australian jungle wilderness.

Alongside Ian, Coronation Street stars Alan Halsall and Lucy Fallon are also tipped to head to Austrlia. Love Island and Towie star Olivia Attwood has also been surrounded by rumours.

(Image: Action Plus via Getty Images)

(Image: Getty Images)

Made In Cheslea's Jamie Laing, Strictly champ Stacey Dooley and presenter Richard Madeley also have fans hopeful.

Another rumoured appearance was that of Bake Off"s Paul Hollywood's former flame, Summer Monteys-Fullam.

Harry also dished that although he can't wait to see Ant and Dec back together for the next series, Holly Willoughby did a stand up job stepping in for Ant last year.

"They're a great duo," he said, "But Holly did an amazing job filling in, that's for sure. She came over great as well.

"The three of them have all been marvellous, really."

Harry Redknapp was speaking at a McDonald's Fun Football Session where he helped deliver the 2,000,000th hour of the Fun Football programme.

description: EXCLUSIVE: Harry Redknapp is convinced rumoured I'm A Celeb contestant Ian Wright will struggle in the Aussie jungle
